title: Oopsie at the Oscars
puzzle:
Tina Fey: Why do I always get the name that requires dramatic emphasis? I swear, if I mispronounce Leonardo DiCaprio on stage, Twitter will eat me alive.

Amy Poehler: Relax. At least you don’t have to explain a joke while people are actively deciding whether they liked the movie. Mine is literally a joke making fun of the movie — and yes, it’s for Timothée Chalamet. Delicate situation.

Maya Rudolph: Hey, that’s nothing. My card just says Michael B. Jordan. No joke, no commentary, just his name. Very serious vibes.

Amy Poehler: Well, at least it’s not the dating joke. That one would be… complicated. And definitely not something you’d say right after mentioning Michael B. Jordan.

Tina Fey: Speaking of which, whoever has the dating joke better sell it fast and move on. This audience is sharp.

Maya Rudolph: I’m just saying, my card feels important. Like, important important. The kind of important where you don’t want to mess it up.

Amy Poehler: Cool, cool, cool. Love that energy right before we walk out in front of millions of people.

Tina Fey: Okay, jokes, names, vibes — whatever. We really need to figure out who the winner is, because we’re about to go on stage.
question: Who is winning Best Actor?
